posts.post_content:
I want to like this card, I really do. The art is incredible, and I love the concept mechanically. Nevertheless, this card just sucks. Subtract the [Pacifism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pacifism) from [Pillory of the Sleepless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pillory of the Sleepless) and you get a card that should cost ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), not ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol). [Contaminated Bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contaminated Bond) only cost ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) *and* it was better, as it could at least act as soft removal.  
  
To be fair, it's possible this effect is better than I'm giving it credit. I know how demoralizing [Pillory of the Sleepless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pillory of the Sleepless) could be, and if the enchanted creature manages to stick around for three or four turns, that’s not a bad deal for three mana. It still seems overcosted and underpowered though.
posts.html:
I want to like this card, I really do. The art is incredible, and I love the concept mechanically. Nevertheless, this card just sucks. Subtract the Pacifism from Pillory of the Sleepless and you get a card that should cost , not . Contaminated Bond only cost and it was better, as it could at least act as soft removal.

To be fair, it's possible this effect is better than I'm giving it credit. I know how demoralizing Pillory of the Sleepless could be, and if the enchanted creature manages to stick around for three or four turns, that’s not a bad deal for three mana. It still seems overcosted and underpowered though.

Posted By: Laguz (5/22/2010 10:58:32 PM)
Rating:

@Splenivore

Pillory of the Sleepless is a gold card, requireing two colors to play. Gold cards tend to get a 'Gold Discount', having a casting cost 1 or 2 less then they would get if they were a monocolored card (3 or more for gold cards with more then 2 colors). You should have taken that discount into account when using the Pillory as a basis to identify the propper cost for this card.
In other words, B would be too low a cost. 1B would be a better cost.
